Key Arguments: The legislation is an attack on free and open debate, which is essential for a liberal democratic society.
It is impossible to define 'Disinformation' or 'Misinformation' as both sides of a debate may label the other's information as such.
Society needs a diverse and well-funded media to support serious debate, not oversight on what can be discussed.
There should be restrictions on political spending and transparency in government to ensure minority opinions do not overwhelm debate.
Main Themes: Challenges in defining misinformation and disinformation
Political transparency and influence of lobbyists
Notable Quotes: Any attempt to categorise what can and can't be discussed and how it is discussed is an attack on free and open debate.
The two extremes of any debate will categorise the information of the other side as 'Disinformation' or 'Misinformation'.
This act is an attempt to suppress open debate and I strongly object.
